title: Ankur Dhama:Being Visually Impaired To Winning Medals At Asian Para Games, Ankur Dhama's Tale Is Of Resilience
text:
Ankur Dhama is no ordinary talent, rather he typifies what it means to push the limits to win at life when all the odds are stacked up against you.

Born in a small village in Uttar Pradesh, Ankur didn't have a normal childhood like many of us. At a very young age, he started suffering from gradual loss of vision. And it was to get worse, as within a year or two, he would lose his complete vision.

Getty Images

These kind of setbacks don't leave you with much options - but Ankur was spirited and had the resolve to keep going in life. After the suggestion from his doctor, he moved to Delhi and attended JPM Senior Secondary School for the Blind at Lodhi Road.

He was a bright student, and had the tenacity to learn and evolve. After finding love in race tracks, he was still in school when he participated in his first international event. After scoring great grades in school, Ankur Dhama enrolled in the prestigious St.Stephens College.

He kept at sports, while also studying for his degree. The multi-faceted athlete has excelled at turning in excellent grades while fulfilling the demands of a career in competitive sport.

After the early setback in life, Ankur has run through every obstacle and overcome them with his grit and resolve.

His undeterred determination rewarded with a fitting gift in 2014 when he won one silver and two bronze medals at the Asian Para Games. It was the moment must have felt fulfilled; for it was the mighty will triumphing all odds.

Getty Images

Ankur had another moment to savour in 2016 when he represented India at the Paralympic Games in Rio.

For his accomplishments on the tracks, he was awarded the Arjuna award in 2018. Ankur is trying to get better and perform to his fullest. He is targeting the Paralympic Games of 2020.

Ankur Dhama's story is everything that will aspire and inspire you to go out there, and win at life.
